1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Singular
1.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

1.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
1.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

1.str2: To fill with power, strengthen, make strong. From en and dunamoo; to empower.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

2.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

2.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
2.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
A witness (judicially) or figuratively (genitive case); by analogy, a 'martyr'.

2.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
2.str2: From para and tithemi; to place alongside, i.e. Present; by implication, to deposit.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

2.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
2.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From hiko; competent, i.e. Ample or fit.
To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.

3.parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
3.str2: To suffer hardships together with. From sun and kakopatheo; to suffer hardship in company with.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Properly, beautiful, but chiefly good, i.e. Valuable or virtuous.
A soldier. From a presumed derivative of the same as stratia; a camper-out, i.e. A warrior.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

4.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To wage war, fight, serve as a soldier; fig: of the warring lusts against the soul.

4.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To enfold, entangle; pass: To be involved in. From en and pleko; to entwine, i.e. involve with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary word; life, i.e. the present state of existence; by implication, the means of livelihood.
A business, an occupation, affair, transaction. From pragmateuomai; a transaction, i.e. Negotiation.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
4.str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

4.parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Dative Masculine Singular
4.str2: To collect an army, enlist troops. From a compound of the base of stratia and lego; to gather as a warrior, i.e. Enlist in the army.

5.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

5.parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
5.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

5.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To engage, compete, in an (athletic) contest. From athlos; to contend in the competitive games.

5.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To crown, adorn, decorate. From stephanos; to adorn with an honorary wreath.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

5.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
5.str2: To engage, compete, in an (athletic) contest. From athlos; to contend in the competitive games.
Lawfully, rightfully. Adverb from a derivative of nomos; legitimately.

6.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

6.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
6.str2: From a derivative of kopos; to feel fatigue; by implication, to work hard.
From ge and the base of ergon; a land-worker, i.e. Farmer.

6.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
6.str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.
From meta and lambano; to participate; genitive case, to accept.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

7.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
7.str2: From nous; to exercise the mind, i.e. to comprehend, heed.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

7.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
7.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

8.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular

Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

8.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Masculine Singular
8.str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
From speiro; something sown, i.e. Seed; by implication, offspring; specially, a remnant.
David, King of Israel. Of Hebrew origin; Dabid, the Israelite king.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).

From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

21.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
21.str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary word; 'good'.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.

22.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
22.str2: To flee, escape, shun. Apparently a primary verb; to run away; by implication, to shun; by analogy, to vanish.
Associated with youth, youthful, juvenile. From the comparative of neos; appertaining to younger persons, i.e. Juvenile.
Desire, eagerness for, inordinate desire, lust. From epithumeo; a longing.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.

22.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
22.str2: To pursue, hence: I persecute. A prolonged form of a primary verb dio; to pursue; by implication, to persecute.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
Probably from a primary verb eiro; peace; by implication, prosperity.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

22.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Plural
22.str2: (a) To call (name) by a supplementary (additional, alternative) name, (b) mid: To call upon, appeal to, address.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

23.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.

23.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
23.str2: From para and the middle voice of aiteo; to beg off, i.e. Deprecate, decline, shun.
Probably from the base of musterion; dull or stupid, i.e. Heedless, blockhead, absurd.
Untrained, uneducated, showing a want of training or education, ignorant. Uninstructed, i.e. stupid.
A question, debate, controversy; a seeking, search. From zeteo; a searching, i.e. A dispute or its theme.

23.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular

23.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

23.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
23.str2: From a variation of genos; to procreate; figuratively, to regenerate.
From machomai; a battle, i.e. controversy.

24.str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

24.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
24.str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

24.parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
24.str2: To engage in battle, fight; hence: To strive, contend, dispute.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Placid, gentle, mild. Probably from epos; properly, affable, i.e. Mild or kind.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Able to teach, apt to teach. From didaktos; instructive.
Enduring evil, patient of evil, patiently forbearing. From anechomai and kakos; enduring of ill, i.e. Forbearing.

25.str2: Mildness, gentleness. From praus; mildness, i.e. humility.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
25.str2: From pais; to train up a child, i.e. Educate, or, discipline.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Accusative Masculine Plural
25.str2: To set myself against, oppose. From anti and diatithemai; to set oneself opposite, i.e. Be disputatious.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

25.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
25.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From metanoeo; compunction; by implication, reversal (another's) decision).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From epiginosko; recognition, i.e. full discernment, acknowledgement.

26.word: they will come to their senses
26.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
26.str2: To become sober again, recover sound sense. From ana and nepho; to become sober again, i.e. regain senses.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From pegnumi; a trap; figuratively, a trick or statagem.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.

26.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
26.str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

26.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
26.str2: To capture alive, capture for life, enthrall. From the same as zoon and agreuo; to take alive, i.e. to capture or ensnare.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
An act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires. From the prolonged form of ethelo; a determination, i.e. choice or inclination.
